alert.note: Alert for Crockett; Dyer; Lauderdale (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 05 at 10:09PM CST until March 06 at 4:10AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Tennessee... South Fork of the Forked Deer near Halls affecting Crockett, Lauderdale and Dyer Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...South Fork of the Forked Deer near Halls. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Farmland near the river is flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CST Sunday the stage was 9.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM CST Sunday was 9.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 2.4 feet Friday evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.1 feet on 02/05/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 415 AM CST.
